summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/11/01 Average Rating: 3.0 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Terry McDonagh'], 'Starring': ['Ray Winstone', 'Suranne Jones'], 'Studio': ['FilmRise']} Review Text: On a whim, I came across this British mystery series and decided to watch. I'm on the 2nd season and have thoroughly enjoyed the series ... it's too bad that it ends with 2nd season. would've been nice to have more added. Review Title: On a whim Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/02/05 Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Byrum Geisler'], 'Producers': ['Brandon Garza', 'Alex Bice', 'Wes Ross'], 'Starring': ['Ethan Sharrett', 'Chase Conner', 'Brandi Price'], 'Studio': ['Washington House']} Review Text: I decided to give this film 5 stars because of the movie's themes even though the story was somewhat slow to develop. These are new actors that I wasn't familiar with but I especially developed a strong bond with Ben Bennett. You could see how much he wanted to tell Lee about his feelings but was afraid to do so.
The film deals with the real problems that a relationship like this one can bring. It was moving to see a happy ending like this one. Review Title: Makes You Think Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/03/08 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['John Korty', 'Arthur Hiller'], 'Producers': ['David Golden', 'Howard G. Minsky'], 'Starring': ['Ali MacGraw', "Ryan O'Neal", 'John Marley'], 'Studio': ['Paramount Pictures']} Review Text: I watched this in 1970 & loved it. Now 49 yrs later, it still has the same effect ... a universal love theme with a sad ending. superb acting by R. O'Neal and A. McGraw Review Title: Epic Love Story Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/05/07 Average Rating: 4.1 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Alejandro Bazzano'], 'Producers': ['Nacho Manubens', 'Sonia Martinez', 'Josep Cister Rubio', 'Aitor Montanchez'], 'Starring': ['Miguel angel Muñoz', 'Susi Sanchez', 'Elvira Minguez'], 'Studio': ['Atresmedia Television']} Review Text: This was one of the best productions I've seen from Spain. Beautiful cinematography and breathtaking scenes of the Basque country. One of the reasons I chose to watch it is just that to see the country scenes. This seems to be a "film noir" type with a good plot and an unexpected ending. All new actors for me however, I had seen Susi Sanchez acting in a previous Spanish film. The only thing that I felt was NOT NECESSARY were all the sex scenes in the earlier episodes ... don't believe this contributed to the plot or if they had to throw in sex, the directors could have given it a "softer" touch ... I didn't dock any stars for that though. For those language fans out there, there's a lot of the Basque language you see in the film ... and I picked up some of the simpler Basque greetings. Recommended for mature audiences. Review Title: Good Acting and Unexpected Ending Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Ashes in the Snow Review Date: 2019/06/27 Categories: Historical, Romance, Downbeat, Emotional Product Description: ["During World War II, a 16 year-old aspiring artist and her family are deported to Siberia amidst Stalin's brutal dismantling of the Baltic region. One girl's passion for art and her never-ending hope will break the silence of history."] Average Rating: 4.1 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Marius Markevicius'], 'Producers': ['Marius Markevicius', 'Zilvinas Naujokas', 'Chris Coen', 'Prithvi Chavan'], 'Starring': ['Bel Powley', 'Sophia Cookson', 'Lisa Loven Kongsli']} Review Text: If I could give this 10 stars I would. I always enjoy historical films and I was blown away by this film. Beautiful cinematography and outstanding acting. Although it had some violent scenes, I believe the film conveyed the message how these innocent families struggled, survived and perished under Stalin's rule. Recommended for those interested in history. Review Title: Extraordinary historical account Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/06/29 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Rose Bosch'], 'Producers': ['Jean-Robert Gibard', 'Alain Goldman', 'Catherine Morisse', 'Christer von Lindequist'], 'Starring': ['Jean Reno', 'Melanie Laurent', 'Gad Elmaleh'], 'Studio': ['Menemsha Films']} Review Text: An explicit historical account of the Velodrome d'hiver Round up (La Rafle) in Paris where thousands of Jews were arrested in mass and placed in extremely crowded conditions at the velodrome.
A very emotional film depicting the horror of mass murder of innocent people in transit to Auschwitz.
Beautiful cinematography and outstanding acting. Highly recommended for those interested in historical drama. Review Title: Emotional Account of the Vel D'Hiver Round up in Paris Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Bitter Harvest (2016) Review Date: 2019/07/12 Categories: Action, Drama, Gritty, Harrowing Product Description: ['Starring Academy Award® nominee Terence Stamp, BITTER HARVEST is a powerful story of survival, honor, and rebellion told through the eyes of two star-crossed lovers.'] Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['George Mendeluk'], 'Producers': ['Stuart Baird', 'Chard Barager', 'Jaye Gazeley', 'Ian Ihnatowycz'], 'Starring': ['Max Irons', 'Samantha Barks', 'Barry Pepper']} Review Text: The film had superb cinematography. This was a historical drama in remembrance of the Holodomor Genocide in Ukraine 1932-33.
I had never heard of this horrific tragedy in the history of mankind. It was a sad representation of the horrors of the Ukranian people but at the same time showing the determination of the people's desire to fight back.
Highly recommended for world history students. Review Title: Bitter Harvest - Remembering the genocide in Ukraine 1932-33 Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/08/02 Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Gillian Armstrong'], 'Producers': ['Sarah Curtis', 'Douglas Rae'], 'Starring': ['Cate Blanchett', 'Billy Crudup', 'Michael Gambon'], 'Studio': ['WARNER BROS.']} Review Text: If you're drawn to romance and historical films, then you will like this movie. Cate Blanchett is excellent in her role as a young British girl devoted to her country and determined to help in the war efforts of WWII. Supporting actors help develop the plot.
I was moved with the one of the themes of this film that being helping Jewish people escape the horrible fate that would await them once in the hands of the Nazis.
Cinematography is superb. Review Title: Beautiful film in many ways Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/08/03 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Pepe Danquart'], 'Producers': ['Susa Kusche', 'Uwe Spiller'], 'Starring': ['Andrzej Tkacz', 'Kamil Tkacz', 'Elisabeth Duda'], 'Studio': ['Menemsha Films']} Review Text: I normally don't watch foreign films but something stood out about the title. The film is subtitled in English as the actors speak Polish, Yiddish, and German.
The acting was superb ... my hat's off to the young boy actor (main character) for his acting talent.
The film is based on a true story about Yoram Fridman who as a young boy survived largely by himself for 3yrs from 1942-44 in Nazi occupied Poland. (There's also a book by same title but I haven't read it) Review Title: Sad but inspiring story of courage Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/08/30 Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Mikko Makela'], 'Producers': ['Mikko Makela', 'James Robert Shamsheer Watson', 'Jarno Pimperi'], 'Starring': ['Janne Puustinen', 'Boodi Kabbani', 'Mika Melender'], 'Studio': ['Roseaux Ltd.']} Review Text: This was a foreign film I believe filmed in Finland with some Finnish dialogues (subtitled). While the film had a universal theme of the struggles of gay love relationships ( in this case, compounded by migrant issues), I believe that the dialogue between the two main characters could have been more profound.
For that reason, I knocked off 1 star. It had beautiful outdoor scenery. A bittersweet story of two gay men experiencing falling in love and faced with serious choices. Review Title: Bittersweet story but good theme Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/09/08 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English'], 'Directors': ['John Patrick Shanley'], 'Producers': ['Scott Rudin'], 'Starring': ['Meryl Streep', 'Philip Seymour Hoffman', 'Amy Adams'], 'Studio': ['Paramount']} Review Text: It has been a while since I have enjoyed a film of this magnitude. The performances of three main personalities, Streep as Sister Aloysius, Hoffman as Father Flynn and Adams as sister James unifies one of the main themes of the film - Power struggle.
The film peeks into the persecution of Roman Catholic priests during the 60's in regards to pedophiles. I loved Hoffman's portrayal of the priest showing compassion and love. This was one of his best performances.
Streep, as always, is outstanding in her artistic abilities. A moving dramatic story. Review Title: Outstanding performances by Streep, Hoffman, Adams Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
**Shopping Preferences and Patterns Summary**

- **Genres of Interest**: Strong preference for historical dramas, romance, and emotional narratives. Frequent engagement with British and foreign films, particularly those with meaningful themes.
  
- **Themes and Content**: Enjoyment of complex themes such as love (often with bittersweet endings), relationships, survival against adversity, and historical accuracy. Frequent viewing of films that tackle issues like war, social struggles, and personal growth.

- **Emotional Connection**: Tendency to connect deeply with character-driven stories and appreciate high-quality acting and cinematography. Positive reactions to films with moving narratives and emotional depth.

- **Review Ratings**: Consistently high ratings (mostly 5-star) indicating a strong appreciation for quality content. Shows willingness to overlook minor flaws if the overall storytelling resonates emotionally.

- **Diverse Formats**: Engages with both subtitled foreign films and English-language productions, indicating an openness to different cultures and languages.

- **Content Advisory Sensitivity**: Awareness and commentary on explicit content (violence, sexual content), showing a selective preference for certain maturity levels while maintaining interest in impactful storytelling.

Overall, this individual demonstrates a clear passion for impactful storytelling, especially in historical and romantic contexts, with a focus on the emotional and artistic merits of the films.

target_interaction.title: Nordic drama with suspense
target_interaction.text: This was an Icelandic drama worth watching if you don’t mind reading the English subtitles.  20 episodes long but I was drawn into the mystery and suspense that I didn’t mind the lengthy story (seasons 1&2).  Well produced & good story line.
